Package com.epsonconnectjava

Class AuthCtx

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epsonconnectjava.AuthCtx
  • public class AuthCtx
extends java.lang.Object
    AuthCtx class is responsible for handling authentication with the Epson Connect API. It also provides utility methods to send HTTP requests using a specified HttpClient.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  AuthCtx.ApiError
      Exception indicating a general API error.
      static class  AuthCtx.AuthenticationError
      Exception indicating an authentication error with the API.

      • AuthCtx

        public AuthCtx​(java.lang.String baseUrl,
               java.lang.String printerEmail,
               java.lang.String clientId,
               java.lang.String clientSecret)
        Constructor for AuthCtx with specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - Base URL for the API.
        printerEmail - Email associated with the printer.
        clientId - Client ID for API authentication.
        clientSecret - Client secret for API authentication.

      • AuthCtx

        public AuthCtx​(HttpClient httpClient,
               java.lang.String baseUrl,
               java.lang.String printerEmail,
               java.lang.String clientId,
               java.lang.String clientSecret)
        Main constructor for AuthCtx.
        Parameters:
        httpClient - The HTTP client to use for making requests.
        baseUrl - Base URL for the API.
        printerEmail - Email associated with the printer.
        clientId - Client ID for API authentication.
        clientSecret - Client secret for API authentication.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public org.json.JSONObject send​(okhttp3.Request.Builder requestBuilder)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an HTTP request using the specified request builder.
        Parameters:
        requestBuilder - The request builder to use for creating the HTTP request.
        Returns:
        A JSONObject containing the response data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's an error during the HTTP request.

      • auth

        public void auth()
        Authenticates the client with the Epson Connect API. If the client is already authenticated and the token hasn't expired, it does nothing. Otherwise, it refreshes the token or authenticates for the first time.

      • deauthenticate

        public void deauthenticate()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Deauthenticates the client from the Epson Connect API.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's an error during deauthentication.
